channel.title: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038
channel.description:
http://www.filedropper.com is running a "green" promotion. You can go to http://www.filedropper.com/green-project.php and register for a free account. The site usually charges for $10 dollars a month on this type of account.
Enjoy!

item.title: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:

…[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:26, topic:261360”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=345159.msg2676729#msg2676729 date=1235112957]

…8 accounts registered so far, 21 tabs still open with more to come.

doubt you’ll ever use it all…

lol at like jan 17th 2038 your oging to be like SHIT NEED TO DOWNLOAD MY 100+tb BACK UPS PORN SHIT SHIT SHIT!

100+TB then will be 10kB to us now.
[/quote]
149 KB is more likely (If The disc need double every 18 months.), but if you make too many accouts you risk that they will delete your accounts.
And discplace is not free so if every body upload 100TB to Skydrive it will no more discplace on the server.[/quote]
You’re right, I decided to stop after the first 8… hopefully they won’t delete them.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:17, topic:261360”][quote author=jme link=topic=345159.msg2662987#msg2662987 date=1234325187]

FileDropper wants to help. We want to help people store and share their documents electronically. We don’t want you to waste paper printing, so we are offering 100GB file hosting accounts for free.

Well I think running a server 24/7 uses a lot of electricity and thats not green! We are never going to give up paper. We have been using it for thousands and even Tech Paper wont take over!

We should grow hemp for paper. In the same amount of area as a field of timber trees, you can make 4 times more paper. Not only that but it’s extremely high quality paper. It can last over 100 years without going yellow. The declaration of independence was written on hemp paper. Too bad its illegal

And yeah thanks for the link. This will come in handy if it truly lasts long.
[/quote]That was a very informative movie :P[/quote]

Hah I just realized that is where I pulled it from. I knew about paper long before, other then how long it can last.

Read full topic
item.source: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038

item.title: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:15, topic:261360”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=345159.msg2662281#msg2662281 date=1234294180]

FileDropper wants to help. We want to help people store and share their documents electronically. We don’t want you to waste paper printing, so we are offering 100GB file hosting accounts for free.

Well I think running a server 24/7 uses a lot of electricity and thats not green! We are never going to give up paper. We have been using it for thousands and even Tech Paper wont take over!
[/quote]

We should grow hemp for paper. In the same amount of area as a field of timber trees, you can make 4 times more paper. Not only that but it’s extremely high quality paper. It can last over 100 years without going yellow. The declaration of independence was written on hemp paper. Too bad its illegal

And yeah thanks for the link. This will come in handy if it truly lasts long.[/quote]That was a very informative movie

Read full topic
item.source: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038

item.title: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Fat Cookies:

Well I think running a server 24/7 uses a lot of electricity and thats not green!

You’re thinking on the right lines, but using computers to abolish (or mostly abolish paper) is still much “greener”. The amount of electricity used to run a server is pretty small compared to the sheer amount of paper a single office gets through in a year (think about all those memos before email)

Read full topic
item.source: How to get a 250GB skydrive until 2038

We should grow hemp for paper. In the same amount of area as a field of timber trees, you can make 4 times more paper. Not only that but it’s extremely high quality paper. It can last over 100 years without going yellow. The declaration of independence was written on hemp paper. Too bad its illegal

And yeah thanks for the link. This will come in handy if it truly lasts long.
